turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Tennis in Scotland.
turn.1: Who was the leading female player of the 20th century?
turn.2: Winnie Shaw (1947–1992) was the French Open finalist in both Mixed Doubles and Women's Doubles; Australian Open semi-finalist in Singles; Wimbledon semi-finalist in Women's Doubles, and quarter-finalist in Singles.
turn.3: Who was the leading male player?
turn.4: George Kelly took up tennis after his retirement from association football.
turn.6: Kelly started playing Tennis with Johnny King and the pair almost made the 1970 Wimbledon Championships.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Robin Welsh (1869 –1934) is another example of a Scottish tennis player better known for another sport, in this case curling.
turn.9: What other players are mentioned in the article?
turn.10: With partner John Paish, John Clifton was a doubles runner-up at Newport, Wales in 1971.
turn.12: Clifton also made the second round of the singles at the 1971 Wimbledon Championships and the third round of the men's doubles at the 1973 Wimbledon Championships (with Stanley Matthews).
